root: ^I was sitting on concrete stairs when that old lady told me to get up, or I would never ever have children. My actions?
^Get up immediately and thank her for caring
^Troll the old lady and stay where I was
^Get up and leave, she might be a witch!
^Get up, but look up for more information on the Internet

res1: ^The old lady nodded at me and left. Nothing interesting
^I was sitting on concrete stairs. An old lady told me to get up, or I would never ever have children. So, I did and thanked her for caring.
res2: ^I got sick and had to go to the hospital. I should have listened to the old lady!
^I was sitting on concrete stairs. An old lady told me to get up, or I would never ever have children. I didn't listen to her and got sick.
res3: ^It creeps me out to think that the old lady cursed me!
^I was sitting on concrete stairs. An old lady told me to get up, or I would never ever have children. I got up and left, as I was scared that the old lady could curse me.
res4: ^It turned out not that bad a problem, but there was still a chance to get sick
^I was sitting on concrete stairs. An old lady told me to get up, or I would never ever have children. I got up and later searched for information on the Internet. It turned out she was partly right.
